title: How to Make Seasoned Roasted Chicken

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 425 degrees for 30 minutes and then reduce to 375 degrees
Spray a roasting pan with nonstick cooking pan.
Spray roasting rack with nonstick cooking spray.
Remove giblets, heart, gizzard from chicken cavity, if required.
Rub chicken with olive oil.
steps.description: Figure about 2 tablespoons, depending on personal taste and the size of the chicken.

steps.headline: Season liberally with Montreal Chicken seasoning or other favorite seasoning mix.
steps.description: Spice Islands is another good choice.

steps.headline: Roast chicken until the meat tests done.
Roast chicken is safely cooked when the temperature registers 165 °F (74 °C).
steps.description: Use a meat thermometer to check for completeness.

steps.headline: Serve with tortillas, Spanish rice, corn.

text: Preheat oven to 425 degrees for 30 minutes and then reduce to 375 degrees  Spray a roasting pan with nonstick cooking pan.  Spray roasting rack with nonstick cooking spray. Place rack inside roasting pan. Remove giblets, heart, gizzard from chicken cavity, if required.  Rinse chicken and pat dry.  Place chicken on roasting rack.  Rub chicken with olive oil. Figure about 2 tablespoons, depending on personal taste and the size of the chicken. Season liberally with Montreal Chicken seasoning or other favorite seasoning mix. Spice Islands is another good choice. Roast chicken until the meat tests done. This should take about 1 hour. Roast chicken is safely cooked when the temperature registers 165 °F (74 °C). Use a meat thermometer to check for completeness. Serve with tortillas, Spanish rice, corn. It serves four people.
